meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The old door scraighed loudly when it was opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate scraighs whenever it is moved.
meanings.sent3: The scraigh of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The scraigh of the brakes echoed through the silent night.
meanings.sent5: The scraigh of the violin pierced through the concert hall.

meanings.sent1: The scraigh of the car alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The scraigh of the seagulls filled the air by the beach.
meanings.sent3: The scraigh of the microphone feedback startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The scraigh of the cat fighting outside was unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The scraigh of the kettle boiling signaled it was tea time.
